intro: Dortmanna erinus var. bellidifolia, commonly known as the bellidifolia erinus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
